p: Recently, clustered regularly interspaced short palindromic repeats (CRISPR) based nucleic acid detection technology has emerged as a powerful tool with the advantages of rapidity, simplicity and a low cost ( Wang et al., 2020). A recent study reported that the CRISPR-based assay was used to detect SARS-CoV-2 in the patient's pharyngeal swab in China ( Ai et al., 2020). The turn-around time (TAT) of CRISPR was 2 h, much faster than RT–PCR (3 h) and mNGS (24 h) ( Ai et al., 2020). The FDA authorized a COVID-19 test that uses the gene-editing technology CRISPR. Sherlock CRISPR SARS-CoV-2 Kit has been developed by Sherlock Biosciences Inc.
